intro: Woodiella, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of a few species that are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plants are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Woodiella species are often found growing on rocky substrates, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
